segment.source: Sending and Receiving Compatibility Data (Windows 10)
segment.target: Sending and Receiving Compatibility Data (Windows 10)

segment.source: The Microsoft® Compatibility Exchange is a web service that propagates application compatibility issues between various data sources, for example Microsoft Corporation, independent software vendors (ISVs) and the ACT Community.
segment.target: The Microsoft® Compatibility Exchange is a web service that propagates application compatibility issues between various data sources, for example Microsoft Corporation, independent software vendors (ISVs) and the ACT Community.

segment.source: Sending and Receiving Compatibility Data
segment.target: Sending and Receiving Compatibility Data

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: The Microsoft® Compatibility Exchange is a web service that propagates application compatibility issues between various data sources, for example Microsoft Corporation, independent software vendors (ISVs) and the ACT Community.
segment.target: The Microsoft® Compatibility Exchange is a web service that propagates application compatibility issues between various data sources, for example Microsoft Corporation, independent software vendors (ISVs) and the ACT Community.

segment.source: This process involves checking for updated compatibility information from Microsoft over the Internet.
segment.target: This process involves checking for updated compatibility information from Microsoft over the Internet.

segment.source: You can send and receive data to keep Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) updated with the latest compatibility information.
segment.target: You can send and receive data to keep Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) updated with the latest compatibility information.

segment.source: The synchronization process includes only the changes made since the last synchronization.
segment.target: The synchronization process includes only the changes made since the last synchronization.

segment.source: During the synchronization process, a dialog box displaying the synchronization status appears.
segment.target: During the synchronization process, a dialog box displaying the synchronization status appears.

segment.source: You can continue to work during this process.
segment.target: You can continue to work during this process.

segment.source: If no new issues have occurred since your last synchronization, the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange uploads your issue information and notifies you that no updates exist.
segment.target: If no new issues have occurred since your last synchronization, the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange uploads your issue information and notifies you that no updates exist.

segment.source: The synchronization process uses the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange to:
segment.target: The synchronization process uses the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange to:

segment.source: Download new information from Microsoft and ISVs, except for the applications for which you choose not to send application data to Microsoft.
segment.target: Download new information from Microsoft and ISVs, except for the applications for which you choose not to send application data to Microsoft.

segment.source: Upload your compatibility issues to Microsoft.
segment.target: Upload your compatibility issues to Microsoft.

segment.source: Upload and download compatibility information from the ACT Community, if you are a member of the ACT Community and agree to share your data.
segment.target: Upload and download compatibility information from the ACT Community, if you are a member of the ACT Community and agree to share your data.

segment.source: For information about configuring your membership in the ACT Community, see Settings Dialog Box - Preferences Tab.
segment.target: For information about configuring your membership in the ACT Community, see Settings Dialog Box - Preferences Tab.

segment.source: For information about which data is sent and received through the Microsoft Compatibility exchange, see Data Sent Through the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange.
segment.target: For information about which data is sent and received through the Microsoft Compatibility exchange, see Data Sent Through the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange.

segment.source: Reviewing and Synchronizing Your Data
segment.target: Reviewing and Synchronizing Your Data

segment.source: Prior to sending your application data to Microsoft, you can review your application list and view the exact data being sent as a text (.txt) file.
segment.target: Prior to sending your application data to Microsoft, you can review your application list and view the exact data being sent as a text (.txt) file.

segment.source: After you are done reviewing the information, you can synchronize your data with Microsoft.
segment.target: After you are done reviewing the information, you can synchronize your data with Microsoft.

segment.source: To review and synchronize your data
segment.target: To review and synchronize your data

segment.source: On the Analyze screen, click Send and Receive.
segment.target: On the Analyze screen, click Send and Receive.

segment.source: Click Review the data before sending.
segment.target: Click Review the data before sending.

segment.source: The Send and Receive Data dialog box shows all of the application data that is to be sent to Microsoft during the synchronization process.
segment.target: The Send and Receive Data dialog box shows all of the application data that is to be sent to Microsoft during the synchronization process.

segment.source: To avoid sending application data for specific applications, see Selecting the Send and Receive Status for an Application.
segment.target: To avoid sending application data for specific applications, see Selecting the Send and Receive Status for an Application.

segment.source: Optionally, click Review all data, save the resulting .txt file locally, and then review the exact XML data that will be sent to Microsoft.
segment.target: Optionally, click Review all data, save the resulting .txt file locally, and then review the exact XML data that will be sent to Microsoft.

segment.source: After you finish reviewing the application list and XML data, click Send.
segment.target: After you finish reviewing the application list and XML data, click Send.
